messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a group of 21 scholars. Amir is connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, Wei, Nisha, and Reza. Sara is connected to Pari, Pam, Kim, Ian, Moin, and Puja. Zack is connected to Matt, Eva, Amy, Gia, Ming, and Prem. Nisha is connected to Reza, Wim, Raj, Jing, and Wei. Raj is connected to Jing, Wei, Reza, and Wim. Pam is connected to Jing, Kim, Ian, Moin, and Puja. Moin is connected to Puja, Pari, Kim, and Ian. Ming is connected to Prem, Matt, Eva, Amy, and Gia. Wei is connected to Reza, Wim, and Eva. Kim is connected to Ian, Puja, and Pari. Ian is connected to Puja and Pari. Gia is connected to Prem, Matt, Eva, and Amy. Reza is connected to Wim, and Jing. Puja is connected to scholars Pari. Prem is connected to Matt, Eva, and Amy. Wim is connected to Jing. Pari is connected to Amy. Amy is connected to Matt. Matt is connected to Eva. You have been told that Prem is donating 50 books and Moin is donating 10 books. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person with the maximum number of books? Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

First, I will identify the person who is donating the maximum number of books. In this case, that person is Prem who is donating 50 books. 

Next, I will trace the shortest path from Amir to Prem. 

Starting from Amir, the connections are as follows: Amir is directly connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, Wei, Nisha, and Reza.

Looking at the connections of these scholars, I see that Reza is connected to Wim and Jing. Wim is connected to Jing. Raj is connected to Jing, Wei, Reza, and Wim. Jing is not directly connected to Prem, so I need to look at the next level of connections.

Wei is connected to Reza, Wim, and Eva. Eva is connected to Matt, and Matt is connected to Prem. 

So, the shortest path from Amir to Prem is: Amir -> Wei -> Eva -> Matt -> Prem.

Answer: Amir, Wei, Eva, Matt, Prem.

Now you have been told Sara is donating 100 books. Now, from Amir what is the shortest path to the person with the maximum number of books?  Remember that you can take books only from one person. Starting from Amir, please list the scholar names in order, including Amir, separated by commas.

First, I will identify the person who is donating the maximum number of books. In this case, that person is now Sara who is donating 100 books. 

Next, I will trace the shortest path from Amir to Sara. 

Starting from Amir, the connections are as follows: Amir is directly connected to Wim, Raj, Jing, Wei, Nisha, and Reza.

Looking at the connections of these scholars, none of them are directly connected to Sara, so I need to look at the next level of connections. 

Nisha is connected to Reza, Wim, Raj, Jing, and Wei. None of these are connected to Sara, so I need to keep looking.

Raj is connected to Jing, Wei, Reza, and Wim. Jing is connected to Pam, and Pam is connected to Sara.

So, the shortest path from Amir to Sara is: Amir -> Raj -> Jing -> Pam -> Sara.

Answer: Amir, Raj, Jing, Pam, Sara.

policyReval.parsed_response: Answer: Amir, Raj, Jing, Pam, Sara
